Description: Concave fragment of Attic black-figured pottery vase; interior reserved; perhaps the leg of a tripod-pyxis. Palmette cross; red for the hearts of the palmettes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 82 no. 274 pl. 62)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1971)
